title-group.article-title: Convergence, Divergence, and Dialectic in Folksong Paradigms: Critical Directions for Transatlantic Scholarship

abstract.p: This article is a critical survey of recent developments in folksong scholarship on both sides of the Atlantic. In particular, it notes prevailing trends in Britain and North America and the ideologies that have shaped and continue to shape research paradigms. The influence, and confluence, of Marxism and phenomenology as both rival and emergent and explicit philosophies in the analysis of traditional song is the central theme of the discussion.
